elements.name: controlId
elements.description: Always 10

elements.name: summaryFilingActionRequestCode
elements.description:
The action requested for this Entry Summary transaction:
  • Add or entirely Replace an Entry Summary.
  • Add or entirely Replace an Entry Summary.
  • Delete/remove an Entry Summary.

options.A: Add or entirely Replace an Entry Summary
options.R: Add or entirely Replace an Entry Summary

elements.name: entryFilerCode
elements.description: Entry Filer’s identification code (as assigned by CBP).

elements.name: filler1
elements.description: Space fill. Reserved filler for possible future expansion of Entry Filer Code and/or Entry Number.

elements.name: entryNumber
elements.description:
Unique identifying number assigned to the Entry by the Filer.

The check digit must be computed using the formula found in ‘AE Table 1 – Check Digit Computation Formula’.

elements.name: filler2
elements.description: Space fill.

elements.name: districtPortOfEntry
elements.description: The code for the U.S. port that the merchandise is entered (under either an ‘entry’ or an ‘immediate delivery permit’).

elements.name: brokerReferenceNumber
elements.description:
Filer/Preparer’s internal Entry Summary identifier.

Space fill if not used.

elements.name: filler3
elements.description: Space fill until expanded length fully supported. Reserved filler for future expansion of the Broker Reference Number when fully ACE compatible.

elements.name: entryTypeCode
elements.description:
A code identifying the type of entry being submitted.

See ‘AE Table 2 - Entry Type Codes’ for a list of codes supported in this transaction. See Usage Note ‘(e)Entry Type Data Reporting Considerations’ for more information.

elements.name: modeOfTransportationMotCode
elements.description:
A code identifying the mode of transportation by which the merchandise entered the U.S. port of arrival from the last foreign country.

See ‘AE Table 3 - Mode of Transportation Codes’ for a list of codes supported in this transaction.

Space fill if not allowed or not required/not reported.

elements.name: bondWaiverIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the bond has been waived in accordance with C.R. 142.4 (c) or other regulation.
  • Bond waived/no bond required. Additionally, a ‘waiver’ reason may be required to be stated in 10-Record Bond Waiver Reason Code.
Space fill if a bond is required. See Usage Note ‘(i) Bond & Surety Reporting’ for more information.

elements.name: electronicSignature
elements.description:
The Filer’s electronic signature. An ACE Entry Summary is designated as paperless until such time (if any) that CBP requests that a paper document be submitted.
  • Filer’s Electronic Signature.
The Electronic Signature is MANDATORY if the 10-Record Summary Filing Action Request Code is an A (Add) or R (Replace).

elements.name: cargoReleaseCertificationRequestIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Filer is instructing CBP to use the Entry Summary information for the purpose of Cargo Release (i.e., create/process an Entry for the release of the cargo).
  • Certify for ACE Cargo Release.
See Usage Note ‘(ee) Certifying for Cargo Release’ for more information. Space fill if not used; Certify for Cargo Release not requested.

elements.name: electronicInvoiceIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Entry Summary conforms to the requirements for Electronic Invoice Processing (EIP) program: an electronic invoice(s) that accounts for ALL articles claimed on the Entry Summary has EITHER – a) been submitted electronically to CBP, or b) is available for electronic submission when requested by CBP.
  • Electronic Invoice Available.
Space fill if not used; electronic invoice not available.

See Usage Note ‘(t) Electronic Invoice Processing (EIP) Program Reporting Requirements’ for new EIP restrictions and information concerning the status/future of the Automated Invoice Interface (AII) program and the current requirements for its use.

elements.name: consolidatedSummaryIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Entry Summary accounts for (i.e., ‘consolidates’) the cargo referenced in more than one Cargo Release (entry) transaction.
  • Consolidated Entry Summary.
See Usage Note ‘(z) Consolidating Releases Under One Entry Summary’ for more information. Space fill if not used; not consolidated.

elements.name: shipmentUsageTypeCode
elements.description:
An indication that the articles referenced in the summary are for personal use or designated as a commercial sample.
  • Personal Shipment.
  • Sample Commercial Shipment.
Space fill if a Regular Commercial Shipment.

elements.name: liveEntryIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that an Entry / Entry Summary (live) is to be filed.
  • Entry / Entry Summary (live) is to be filed.
Space fill if not used; not a live entry.

options.Y: Entry / Entry Summary (live) is to be filed

elements.name: deferredTaxPaymentCode
elements.description:
An indication that an arrangement has been made with CBP’s National Finance Center (NFC) to defer payment of Internal Revenue (IR) tax to be assessed on this Entry Summary, if any, to a periodic basis.
  • Conventional IR tax payment deferral has been arranged.
  • Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) IR tax payment deferral has been arranged.
Space fill if not used, if no IR tax payment deferral has been arranged and/or if no IR tax applicable for this Entry Summary.

options.1: Conventional IR tax payment deferral has been arranged
options.2: Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT) IR tax payment deferral has been arranged

elements.name: tradeAgreementReconciliationIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that certain issues (such as value, classification, etc.) are to be subject to a future ‘reconciliation’ under an eligible Trade Agreement.
  • Issues to be subject to a future Trade Agreement reconciliation.
Space fill if not used; issues not subject to a future Trade Agreement reconciliation.

options.Y: Issues to be subject to a future Trade Agreement reconciliation

elements.name: reconciliationIssueCode
elements.description:
A code that identifies the specific issue(s) to be reconciled in the future.
  • Value.
  • Classification.
  • Chapter 9802.
  • Value & Classification.
  • Value and Chapter 9802.
  • Classification & Chapter 9802.
  • Value, Classification & Chapter 9802.
Space fill if not used.

elements.name: filler4
elements.description: Space fill.

elements.name: paymentTypeCode
elements.description:
A code that specifies the intended payment method for the Entry Summary. If statement is the chosen method, the code further specifies the type of payment (Daily or Periodic) and how the system will batch the entry summaries for statement processing.
  • Individual payment (NOT on a statement).
DAILY STATEMENT CODES
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date and filer code.
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and full importer of record number.
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and importer of record number without suffix.
PERIODIC MONTHLY STATEMENT CODES
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date and filer code.
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and full importer of record number.
  • Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and importer of record number without suffix.
Note: If the entry summary includes a Statement Client Branch Identifier, after each of these actions, the system will subsequently batch by Statement Client Branch Identifier.

Space fill if statement fields not allowed.

options.2: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date and filer code.
options.3: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and full importer of record number.
options.5: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and importer of record number without suffix.
options.6: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date and filer code.
options.7: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and full importer of record number.
options.8: Entry summary will be batched by preliminary statement print date, filer code, and importer of record number without suffix.

elements.name: preliminaryStatementPrintDate
elements.description:
The date that the Entry Summary is to appear on the Preliminary Statement.

Space fill if not on Statement or if statement fields not allowed. See Usage Note ‘(j) Basic Article Classification and Tariff Considerations – Duty Rate Date Matrix Hierarchy’.

elements.name: periodicStatementMonth
elements.description:
The calendar month that the Entry Summary is accounted for on the Preliminary Periodic Monthly Statement. (MM Format).

Space fill if not on Periodic Monthly Statement or if statement fields not allowed.

elements.name: statementClientBranchIdentifier
elements.description:
A Filer assigned code that further groups Entry Summaries on a statement.

Space fill if the participant does not use or if statement fields not allowed.

elements.name: bondWaiverReasonCode
elements.description:
When required, the specific reason that the bond has been waived per the 10-Record Bond Waiver Indicator claim.

See Usage Note ‘(i) Bond & Surety Reporting’ for more information. See ‘AE Table 4 – Bond Waiver Reason Codes’. Space fill if not required/not reported.

options.995: Supplemental Duty Bills on Vessel Repair Entries
options.996: Fines, Penalty, or Liquidated Damage Bills

elements.name: postSummaryCorrectionIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the filing is a Post Summary Correction (PSC).

  • Post Summary Correction.

See Usage Note ‘(gg) Filing a Post Summary Correction’ for more information. Space fill if the filing is a conventional Entry Summary.

elements.name: acceleratedLiquidationRequestIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the filer/importer is requesting that CBP accelerate the liquidation for the Post Summary Correction.

  • Accelerated Liquidation Requested.

See Usage Note ‘(gg) Filing a Post Summary Correction’ for more information. Space fill if the filing is a conventional Entry Summary or if PSC accelerated liquidation is not requested.

elements.name: knownImporterIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Importer of Record reported in the 11-Record is a Known Importer.

  • Importer of Record is a Known Importer.

Space fill if not used.

options.Y: Importer of Record is a Known Importer.

elements.name: pgaDataIncludedIndicator
elements.description:
An indication of the type of Entry Summary being submitted, used by the system to facilitate PGA data reporting requirements.

  • Expedited release. The cargo referenced in this entry summary has been released via an expedited entry program (i.e., FAST, BRASS, or Rail Line Release).
  • Weekly FTZ. The cargo referenced in this type ‘06’ entry summary is associated with a ‘weekly’ FTZ withdrawal.

Space fill if not used.

See Usage Note ‘(dd) Articles Released Via Expedited Release/Weekly FTZ Subject to PGA Reporting’ for more information.

options.Y: Expedited release. The cargo referenced in this entry summary has been released via an expedited entry program (i.e., FAST, BRASS, or Rail Line Release).
options.F: Weekly FTZ. The cargo referenced in this type ‘06’ entry summary is associated with a ‘weekly’ FTZ withdrawal.

elements.name: tibDeclarationIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Temporary Importation Under Bond (TIB) conforms to the conditions required for this type of Entry Summary.

  • “I certify that the articles are to be used according to the terms, conditions and provisos of the HTS subheading as declared herein and applies to the articles entered, that the articles will not be used for any other use and that the articles are not imported for sale or sale upon approval. I declare that the articles will be exported or destroyed within the applicable 6-month or 1-year period from the date of importation, unless extended.”

Space fill if not a TIB.

options.Y: “I certify that the articles are to be used according to the terms, conditions and provisos of the HTS subheading as declared herein and applies to the articles entered, that the articles will not be used for any other use and that the articles are not imported for sale or sale upon approval. I declare that the articles will be exported or destroyed within the applicable 6-month or 1-year period from the date of importation, unless extended.”

elements.name: consolidatedExpressInformalIndicator
elements.description:
An indication that the Entry Summary accounts for (i.e., ‘consolidates’) cargo manifest-only released shipments for/at an Express Consignment carrier/facility.

  • Consolidated Express Informal Entry Summary.

See Usage Note ‘(jj) Consolidated Express Filings’ for more information. Space fill if not used; does not apply.

elements.name: filler5
elements.description: Space fill.
